discovery_rule.name: AWS EC2 ELB Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of Amazon AWS EC2 Elastic Load Balancers.

item_prototype.name: HTTPCode_Backend_4XX : {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
item_prototype.description: The number of HTTP response codes generated by registered instances. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

item_prototype.name: HTTPCode_Backend_5XX : {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
item_prototype.description: The number of HTTP response codes generated by registered instances. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

item_prototype.name: Latency : {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
item_prototype.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response is received.

item_prototype.name: RequestCount : {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
item_prototype.description: The number of completed requests that were received and routed to the registered instances.

item_prototype.name: SpilloverCount : {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
item_prototype.description: The total number of requests that were rejected because the queue was full.

item_prototype.name: UnHealthyHostCount : {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
item_prototype.description: The number of unhealthy instances in each Availability Zone. An instance is considered unhealthy if it exceeds the unhealthy threshold configured for the health checks. If cross-zone load balancing is enabled, the number of unhealthy instances is calculated across all Availability Zones.

trigger_prototype.name: Latency too high on {#LOADBALANCERNAME}
trigger_prototype.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response is received.

trigger.name: Cloudwatch All traffic decreased more than 10% in the last 10 minutes
Cloudwatch All traffic decreased more than 20% in the last 10 minutes
Cloudwatch All traffic increased more than 10% in the last 10 minutes
Cloudwatch All traffic increased more than 20% in the last 10 minutes
Cloudwatch traffic items are not being updated
Less than the minimum required machines in the Autoscaling pool
RDS Items are not being updated
RDS More than 200M of swap usage
RDS Read Latency bigger than 1 second
RDS Write Latency bigger than 1 second
